title: Can I import my own notes from a file on my device?
content: Yes! You can drag and drop them or select 'Open Note' from the command (⌘) menu.

title: What file types are supported?
content: Currently, Notetxt supports plain text (.txt) and Markdown (.md) files.

title: How can I manage all of my notes?
content: The note manager. Use the button next to the command menu button to open the note manager. From there, you can navigate to, rename, save, create, or delete notes.

title: Are there keyboard shortcuts?
content: Yes, there are various keyboard shortcuts you can use which are binded to do certain things. Visit the GitHub repository for a list of them, or view them in the command menu.

title: How do I view my note in Markdown?
content: You can toggle the Markdown preview mode by using the 'Preview Markdown' option from the command menu or the keyboard shortcut for it (Ctrl/⌘+M).
